title: 106_hr428
content:
SECTION 1. ADJUSTMENT OF STATUS FOR CERTAIN PERSIAN GULF EVACUEES. The Attorney General will adjust the status of eligible aliens to that of lawful permanent residents if they meet certain criteria and pay a processing fee. Aliens eligible for adjustment include specific individuals named in the provision. The Attorney General will adjust the status of eligible aliens to that of lawful permanent residents if they meet certain criteria and pay a processing fee. Specific individuals eligible for adjustment include Salah Abu-El-Jibat, Ghada Salameh, Tareq Abu-El-Jibat, Jehad Mustafa, Amal Mustafa, Raed Mustafa, Shaher M. Abed, Laila Abed, Zaid Khan, Nadira Khan, Rawhi Abu Tabanja, Basima Abu Tabanja, Mohammed Abu Tabanja, Reuben D'Silva, Anne D'Silva, Natasha D'Silva, Agned D'Silva, Ali H. Alkhaleel, Fatin A. Alkhaleel, Abbas I. Bhikhapurwala, Nafisa Bhikhapurwala, Tasnim Bhikhapurwala, Fayez Ezzir, Abeer Ezzir, Sharif Ezzir, Mohammed Ezzir, Issam Musleh, Nadia Khader, Duaa Musleh, Ahmad Khalil, Mona Khalil, Sally Khalil, Husam Al-Khadrah, Kathleen Al-Khadrah, Nawal M. Hajjawi, Isam S. Naser, Samar I. Naser, and Amalia Arsua. The following individuals are also eligible for adjustment of status to lawful permanent residents: Feras Taha, Mahmoud M. El-Essa, Emad Jawwad, Mohammed Alawamleh, Yacoub Ibrahim, Tareq Shehadah, Basim Al-Ali, Hael Basheer Atari, Fahim N. Mahmoud, Tareq A. Attari, Ahmad M. Mobaslat, Mohammed A. Shayib, Awwad Al-Habli. The individuals eligible for adjustment of status to lawful permanent residents include Yasmin Al-Habli, Hala Al-Habli, Ibraheem Al-Habli, Maamoun Ahmad, Sanaa Hakkani, Azmi A. Mukahal, Wafa Mukahal, Nabil El-Hawwash, Amal M. Shawish, Ishaq El-Hawwash, Sameeh Elsharif, Sahar Elsharif, Sarah Elsharif, Samir Ghalayini, Ismat F. Abujaber, Wasef Ghalayini, Iman Mallah, Rana Mallah, Muhanad Mallah, Mohssen Mahmoud, Alia Al Rafie, Nijad Abdelrahman, Najwa Abdalla, Faisal Abdelrahman, Nezam Mahdawi, Sohad Mahdawi, Bassam Mahdawi, Khalid S. Mahmoud, Fawzieh Mahmoud, Wael Saymeh, Zatelhimma Al Sahafie, Duaa Saymeh, Ahmad Saymeh, Ahmed M. Naji, Sesinando P. Suaverdez, Cynthia Suaverdez, Maria. (41) Ahmed M. Naji.
(42) Sesinando P. Suaverdez, Cynthia Suaverdez, Maria Cristina Suaverdez, and Sesinando Suaverdez II.
(43) Thabet Said, Hanan Said, and Yasmin Said.
(44) Hani Salem, Manal Salem, Tasnim Salem, and Suleiman Salem.
(45) Ihsan Adwan, Hanan Adwan, Maha Adwan, Nada Adwan, Reem Adwan, and Lina Adwan.
(46) Ziyad Al Ajjouri and Dima Al Ajjouri.
(47) Essam Taha.
(48) Mohamed Suleiman and Salam Suleiman.
(49) Salwa S. Beshay, Alexan L. Basta, Rehan Lamai, and Sherif Lamai.
(50) Latifeh Hussin, Sameer Hussin, Anas Hussin, Ahmed Hussin, Ayman Hussin, and Assma Hussin.
(51) Fadia Shaat, Bader Shaat, Dalia Shaat, Abdul Azim Shaat, Farah Shaat, and Rawan Shaat.
(52) Bassam Barqawi and Amal Barqawi.
(53) Nabil A. Maswadeh. (c) Waiver of Certain Grounds for Inadmissibility.--The provisions of subsection (e) and paragraphs (4), (5), and (7)(A) of subsection (a) of section 212 of the Immigration and Nationality Act shall not apply to adjustment of status under this Act and the Attorney General may waive any other provision of section 212 of the Immigration. Upon approval of an adjustment of status application, the Attorney General will record the alien's admission as a lawful permanent resident from the date of parole or entry. Each approval will reduce the total number of immigrant visas available by 1 in the current or next fiscal year. The Attorney General will refrain from deporting eligible aliens for adjustment of status under this section and authorize them to work in the United States.
